alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 8:47PM PST until December 26 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM SUNDAY TO NOON PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills 10 to 20 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph producing blowing and drifting snow and briefly reduced visibility. * WHERE...Disautel Pass, Brewster, Omak, Bridgeport, Nespelem, Oroville, and Okanogan. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 1 AM Sunday to Noon PST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will be showery in nature. Intermittent bands of heavier snow are expected into Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
